body.name: Freedom's Ransom (A Freedom Novel Book 4)
body.description: Enslaved on an uninhabited planet by the alien Eosi, Kristin Bjornsen and her fellow humans not only survived against all odds to colonize the world now known as Botany, but liberated themselves from their captors and claimed it as their home… The colonists could not have achieved victory without the help of the exiled Catteni alien, Zainal, who helped Kris contact other races subjugated by the Eosi, and inspired the rebellion that freed them all. To ensure Botany’s future, its people must build alliances. In the wake of alien devastation, Earth has been looted of its technology—technology Botany desperately needs. If Kris and Zainal can reclaim the stolen goods, they can assist Earth while setting a foundation for Botany’s place in the universe… Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Freedoms Landing series
reviews.reviewText: This is an Anne McCaffery series which should be all the review needed. If you are not familiar with Anne McCaffery, you need to know that the series is logical and consistent. The characters are engaging and well developed. Folks, this is just a good book, and if you want more…The stories of Pern. Should fit you just right, I envy the enjoyment you have awaiting you.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars They need a 5th book
reviews.reviewText: I am aware Anne McCaffery has moved on to another realm, but her son Todd has taken over. He should write a 5th concluding book to this series as this one just kind of stopped. I love these 4 books its the 3rd time since they came out that I have read the. I do like where this last book was going, but it is like it was rushed and cut short to get to the publisher as there are a lot of unanswered questions. Still a very awesome book and series.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A good series
reviews.reviewText: The whole series is a good read. It is a great story, and has great heroes. Fun to read all of the books.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Freedom's Ransom continuous the fine standards set by the other books in this series. Sci-fi and fantasy mixed with just a touch of salt and spice. A joy to read, and to read again. Strong male and female protagonists.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2013
reviews.reviewText: This review is strictly for the audio books as most people will read the books first and then buy the audio book as a supplement. I first bought the Freedom series on cassette tapes (yes, I AM that old) and just fell in love with the acting of the two performers; Susie Breck and Dick Hill. They are just absolutely stunning with their vocal talents and help bring Anne McCaffrey's stories to brilliant life. I love audio books. They help pass the time when travelling long-distance in my car, make the walk with the dog not so boring, and help me survive traffic without resorting to road-rage.As anyone who has ever read an Ann McCaffrey story knows, she is just brilliant in bringing her fantasy worlds to life; so much so, that you have to keep reminding yourself that there are no such things as Catteni, Earth has never been attacked by aliens, and (for the Pern series) that there are NO dragons. She has a true gift with her different worlds she creates and it makes each book pure escapism.Susie Breck and Dick Hill have truly ruined me on just one actor taking on numerous characters. They each have such distinct voices for each character, that you don't need the "Zainal said," and "Kris said," to clarify. They help bring the words they perform to vivid life and you just get lost in the story and forget you're being "read" too.If you have any doubts about any book performed by these two actors, don't hesitate. They help the super talent author bring her stories to life.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good ending to this series
reviews.reviewText: Enjoyed the last installment of the Freedom series. But the other books need to be read first so it all makes sense.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Not quite the adventure you might be anticipating.
reviews.reviewText: I like this series - I have all four books. I was interested where the story line could go after the climax of book three. This book seems like an examination of post apocalyptic market economy rather than the edgy scify action adventure (tinged with racial and species prejudice and discrimination) of the first three. Almost like Anne was looking for a thread to the next great adventure.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Another wonderful series
reviews.reviewText: I have been reading novels by the late, great Anne McCartney for many years. Her characters are so well developed and believable. I have read all 4 books in this series, loved them all.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: In view of the passing of Anne McCaffrey, it is good that this book provides an end to the Catteni Sequence. It goes out on a lovely high, having had a steadily accelerating progress to smash bang finish. This was not my first time reading this set of books, nor do I expect it to be the last: It is already tempting me back.

Non c'è che dire .. Anne McCaffrey era una grande scrittrice e con questa serie dei Catteni ne da ulteriore prova.Presi in originale perché scioccamente nessun editore italiano ne ha tradotto più che il primo libro.Pieno di slang non solo USA ma anche Aussi si riesce a leggere ugualmente bene anche se non sono un madrelinguaVeramente descrittivo as usual .....

reviews.reviewerName: Cassandra A.J. Lee, Founder & Head Lifestyle Designer, InSight Lifestyle Design
reviews.reviewTitle: A Satisfying End to a Great Series
reviews.reviewText: Well rounded and all loose ends tied up in a perfect bow (still somewhat hopeful that there may be room for Todd McCaffrey to take up the story when he finds the time) Thoughtfully written in regards to the aftermath of the Eosi defeat and how various groups decided to self govern afterwards. Anne McCaffrey is sorely missed.

reviews.reviewTitle: As Great As The Dargons of Pern
reviews.reviewText: This saga is set in the future and earth is dominated by a race of Catteni who are under the direction of the Eosi, a high race however not a better race. Kris is a wonderful heroine who gets redeposited on an alien planet with a few hundred of other humans and aliens and Zainal, who beomes the unlikely hero of these series. You find yourself in love with Zainal, once he realizes how wonderful the human race really is. Its a wonderful read as it has something for everyone. I'm myself have re-read this four book series four times already.
Fantastic book couldn't put it down and had to immediately buy the rest of the series. Great condition and fast delivery
